thin_walled_beam_semicircular_section_sp.description: Thin-walled beam with semi-circular cross-section supported by two linear elastic springs at both ends. The beam has length l = 2000 mm and is oriented diagonally in 3D space. Left end shows a semi-circular cross-section with radius R = 200 mm, featuring five webs of thickness t = 1 mm and four stringers of equivalent area A = 200 mm². Vertical upward force P = 1 kN applied at left end. Both ends have spring supports with stiffness k = 10⁶ N/mm, indicated by hatched ground symbols. Right end shows fixed support with hatching. Material properties: E = 70 GPa, ν = 0.3. Cross-section detail at left shows the semi-circular profile with radius R marked. Problem involves determining spring reaction forces accounting for beam shear deformability and plotting internal actions.

bar_varying_cross_section_distributed_lo.description: Horizontal bar with linearly varying cross-sectional area A(x), fixed at left end (hatched support) and free at right end. Bar length l = 400 mm with cross-sectional area varying from A₀ = 5 mm² at left to A₁ = 15 mm² at right, expressed as EA = EA(x). Uniformly distributed axial load n̂ = 2 N/mm applied along entire length (shown by rightward arrows above bar). Concentrated axial force P = 1 kN applied at free right end (rightward arrow). Material properties: E = 70 GPa, ν = 0.3. Problem involves Ritz solution with one degree of freedom to determine stress and displacement at midspan, comparing with exact solution.

exercise_1_structural_frame_force_flow.p.description: Semi-circular thin-walled frame structure showing shear flow distribution analysis. Frame consists of four nodes (labeled 1, 2, 3, 4) connected by curved and straight segments forming a semi-circular shape with vertical left edge. Nodes are numbered: node 2 at top, node 1 at mid-height left, node 3 at mid-height right, and node 4 at bottom left. Shear flows labeled q₁, q₂, q₃, q₄ along curved segments and q₅ along horizontal center chord connecting nodes 1 and 3. Vertical upward force P = 1000 N applied at bottom with moment arm x_ic. Handwritten notes indicate "Evolution of section properties (GA*)" and analysis involves shear flow equations, equivalence to moment, and compatibility conditions (θ₁ = θ₂ and θ₁ = 0). Calculated shear flows: q₁ = q₄ = 1.5275 N/mm, q₂ = q₃ = -0.9725 N/mm. Torsional stiffness x_ic = 122.20 mm noted. Cross-sectional area A* = 654.65 mm² and torsional rigidity GA* = 1.76 × 10⁷ N calculated.

exercise_1_frame_torsional_analysis.png.description: Semi-circular thin-walled frame with torsional moment analysis. Frame shows same geometry as previous with nodes 1-4 and shear flows q₁, q₂, q₃, q₄ along curved segments, plus q₅ along horizontal chord and torsional moment M_t = 10⁶ N·mm applied. Handwritten calculations show: bending stiffness EJ = E(2AR²) = 1.12 × 10¹² N·mm², and torsional analysis with uniform shear flows q₁ = q₂ = q₃ = q₄ = 7.96 N/mm and q₅ = 0. Torsional constant calculation shown: J_t = M_t / (1/(2Ω_cell_k) Σ(q_k l_k/t_k)) = 1.54 × 10⁷ mm⁴, where summation is over panel belonging to cell #k (can consider cell #1 or #2). Final result: GJ = G·J_t = 4.13 × 10¹¹ N·mm². Diagram includes triangular symbols at nodes indicating support/connection points.

reaction_forces_coordinate_systems.png.description: Beam structural analysis showing reaction forces and coordinate system transformations. Left side shows 3D beam with semi-circular cross-section at left end, fixed support (hatched) at top right, with vertical force P and forces X, Y labeled. Beam axis runs diagonally along length with note "beam axis running along the shear center portions". Right side shows two local coordinate systems: first system (x₁, y₁, z₁) at location P+X with rotation angle Yd, second system (x₂, y₂, z₂) at distance d = x_ic with similar orientation. Below are two "dummy" load cases: dummy #1 shows beam with unit vertical force 1 and moment d at fixed end; dummy #2 shows beam with unit vertical force 1 and moment d at fixed end with different orientation. Bottom section labeled "Real System" shows equilibrium equations for forces and moments at two locations (circled 1 and 2): T_y⁽¹⁾ = -(P+X), M_x⁽¹⁾ = -(P+X)z₁, M_z⁽¹⁾ = -(P+X)d, and T_y⁽²⁾ = -(P+X+Y), M_x⁽²⁾ = -(P+X)ℓ₂ - (P+X+Y)z₂, M_z⁽²⁾ = -(P+X+Y)d.

dummy_load_cases_virtual_work.png.description: Two dummy load cases for virtual work analysis. Left diagram (dummy #1): inclined beam with fixed support (hatched) at top right end, unit vertical upward force 1 applied at lower left end, and counterclockwise moment d at the same location. Right diagram (dummy #2): inclined beam with fixed support (hatched) at top right end, unit vertical upward force 1 applied at lower left end, and clockwise moment d (shown with curved arrow) at the same location. Both beams shown at same diagonal orientation. These represent unit load cases for displacement analysis using virtual work method, corresponding to the real system shown in previous diagram.
